1. Add 1 pound of cannellini beans, six cups water, and bay leaf. Cook on high pressure for 35 minutes.
2. After 35 minutes of cooking time and 20 minutes of cooling time, open lid to check if beans are tender.
3. Turn on the heat of pressure cooker and heat some olive oil.
4. Add the processed vegetable mixture, chopped celery, and Italian spice mix. Stir until the onions become translucent.
5. Add some chicken stock and diced tomatoes to it and set the cooking to browning.
6. Add 1 cup of raw paste to it and cook it for about 10-12 minutes.
7. Slice some celery stick into small pieces using food processor and transfer it to a bowl.
8. Mince 3 garlic cloves in food processor. Later add 2 medium onions and 1 coarsely diced carrot and process them.
9. Pour it to a soup bowl and top with some grated Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley and serve.
